Some interesting news about citibank today"
 
 http://www.forbes.com/markets/economy/2008/03/05/citigroup-securities-capital-markets-equity-cx_md_0304markets25.html
 
 
Citigroup, under pressure to raise capital, is making a big bet that it can raise money from yield-hungry investors. It is selling a $2.5 billion bond issue, most of which it is underwriting by itself. 

 
 First of all, their CEO was out today ensuring investors that they were well capitalized and there was little or no risk. Now we find out that not only do they need to beg a few billion more, they cannot even get anybody else to underwrite the bond issue. This also means that they have run out of angel investors. No more pimping out to the arabs. 
 
 
Wednesday, Citigroup (nyse: C - news - people ) said it would sell a 30-year issue, underwriting the lion's share -- $2.1 billion, or 84.0% -- itself. The relatively long-term issue has a relatively yummy yield: 6.875% of face value.

 
 And at loanshark rates. It is almost like they are planning to have them downgraded to junk.
 
 The rest of the article is just about previous desperate attempts that citi has made to shore up capital.
 
 There is an interesting link in all this to something we discussed here before.
 
 http://www.forbes.com/markets/currencies/2008/03/05/ambac-financial-closer-markets-bonds-cx_ra_0305markets37.html
 
 
On Wednesday, Ambac disappointed Wall Street, announcing it would raise $1.5 billion in the public securities markets to shore up its capital. But CreditSights analyst Rob Haines said it falls far short of the $2.5 billion the market had been expecting. 

 
 If you will recall, a week or two ago we posted about an alleged bail out plan for Ambac. I argued that the plan was a load of stinky brown because it specifically cited Citibank as being a bank that would be putting up capital and I (and I think steeeve) pointed out that there was pretty much no way that Citbank was going to be caughing up a few billion to bail out ambac since they were basically bankrupt themselves. 
 
 HEY...waddya know...the bankrupt bank is not going to bail out the bankrupt bond insurer.
 
 It WILL be interesting to see how Ambacs bond offering goes. Surely there are not enough people out there dumbe enouhg to buy that much bad debt??
